page.title: 09Ecology of the Uzmaston area
page.content: This area is a paradise for nature lovers. In the{Spring} the hedgerows are full of sweet smelling primroses, mainly yellowy white in colour with some clumps of deep pink. At Easter they beautify our Churches. Some of the first spring flowers are the snow- drops, crocus and deep yellow Tenby daffodills followed by carpets of bluebells in the woods. Through the{ {Summer}can be seen, dog violets, cowslips, oxlips, wild iris, celandines, dandelions, honeysuckle, columbines, stitchwort, gorse, giant scabious, ox-eye daisy, cow parsley, milkwort, dog roses, red campion, toadflax, herb Robert, buttercups, foxgloves, wild orchids and tufted vetch. Many grasses ferns and trees rival each other including, catkins, pussy willow, hartstongue ferns, holly blackthorn, hawthorn,chestnut and oak.
